Gardening Gloves: Rubber gloves can be used as a protective layer for hands when gardening, as they prevent soil, dirt, and chemicals from coming into direct contact with the skin. This makes gardening tasks more comfortable and safer.
Cleaning Gloves: Rubber gloves can be used as a protective layer when cleaning harsh chemicals or abrasive surfaces. This prevents skin irritation and damage caused by harsh cleaning agents.

DIY Gloves: Rubber gloves can be used as a protective layer when working on DIY projects that involve paint, glue, or other materials. This prevents skin from coming into contact with potentially harmful substances.
Kitchen Gloves: Rubber gloves can be used as a protective layer when handling hot dishes, pots, and pans in the kitchen. This prevents burns and protects hands from heat-related injuries.

Gym Gloves: Rubber gloves can be used as a protective layer during gym workouts, as they provide grip and prevent slipping on equipment. They also protect hands from sweat and moisture-related issues.
